parameters.name: encoded
parameters.description: An array of bytes of data to decode.

methods.name: base64Decode(encoded)
methods.description: Decodes a base-64 encoded string into a UTF-8 byte array.

parameters.name: encoded
parameters.description: The string of data to decode.

parameters.name: charset
parameters.description: ACharsetspecifying the charset of the input.

methods.name: base64Decode(encoded, charset)
methods.description: Decodes a base-64 encoded string into a byte array in a specific character set.

parameters.name: encoded
parameters.description: An array of bytes of web-safe data to decode.

methods.name: base64DecodeWebSafe(encoded)
methods.description: Decodes a base-64 web-safe encoded string into a UTF-8 byte array.

parameters.name: encoded
parameters.description: The string of web-safe data to decode.

parameters.name: charset
parameters.description: ACharsetspecifying the charset of the input.

methods.name: base64DecodeWebSafe(encoded, charset)
methods.description: Decodes a base-64 web-safe encoded string into a byte array in a specific character set.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: A byte[] of data to encode.

methods.name: base64Encode(data)
methods.description:
Generates a base-64 encoded string from the given byte array. Base 64 is a common encoding
accepted by a variety of tools that cannot accept binary data. Base 64 is commonly used in
internet protocols such as email, HTTP, or in XML documents.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The string to encode.

methods.name: base64Encode(data)
methods.description:
Generates a base-64 encoded string from the given string. Base 64 is a common encoding accepted
by a variety of tools that cannot accept binary data. Base 64 is commonly used in internet
protocols such as email, HTTP, or in XML documents.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The string of data to encode.

parameters.name: charset
parameters.description: ACharsetspecifying the charset of the input.

methods.name: base64Encode(data, charset)
methods.description:
Generates a base-64 encoded string from the given string in a specific character set. A Charset
is a way of encoding characters such that they can be encoded. These are typically done in a
binary format, which can generally be incompatible with certain data transmission protocols. To
make the data compatible, they are generally encoded into base 64, which is a common encoding
accepted by a variety of tools that cannot accept binary data. Base 64 is commonly used in
internet protocols such as email, HTTP, or in XML documents.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: An array of bytes of data to encode.

methods.name: base64EncodeWebSafe(data)
methods.description:
Generates a base-64 web-safe encoded string from the given byte array. Base 64 is a common
encoding accepted by a variety of tools that cannot accept binary data. Base 64 web-safe is
commonly used in internet protocols such as email, HTTP, or in XML documents.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The string to encode.

methods.name: base64EncodeWebSafe(data)
methods.description:
Generates a base-64 web-safe encoded string from the given string. Base 64 is a common encoding
accepted by a variety of tools that cannot accept binary data. Base 64 web-safe is commonly
used in internet protocols such as email, HTTP, or in XML documents.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The string of data to encode.

parameters.name: charset
parameters.description: ACharsetspecifying the charset of the input.

methods.name: base64EncodeWebSafe(data, charset)
methods.description:
Generates a base-64 web-safe encoded string from the given string in a specific character set.
A Charset is a way of encoding characters such that they can be encoded. These are typically
done in a binary format, which can generally be incompatible with certain data transmission
protocols. To make the data compatible, they are generally encoded into base 64, which is a
common encoding accepted by a variety of tools that cannot accept binary data. Base 64 web-safe
is commonly used in internet protocols such as email, HTTP, or in XML documents.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: ADateto format as a String.

parameters.name: timeZone
parameters.description: The output timezone of the result.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: A format per theSimpleDateFormatspecification.

methods.name: formatDate(date, timeZone, format)
methods.description:
Formats date according to specification described in Java SE SimpleDateFormat class. Please
visit the specification athttp://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/text/SimpleDateFormat.html

parameters.name: template
parameters.description: The format string that controls what gets returned.

parameters.name: args
parameters.description: Objects to use to fill in the '%' placeholders in the template.

methods.name: formatString(template, args)
methods.description: Performssprintf-like string formatting using '%'-style format strings.

methods.name: getUuid()
methods.description:
Get a UUID as a string (equivalent to using thejava.util.UUID.randomUUID()method). This identifier is not guaranteed to be unique across
all time and space. As such, do not use in situations where guaranteed uniqueness is required.

parameters.name: blob
parameters.description: ABlobobject to compress usinggzip.

methods.name: gzip(blob)
methods.description: gzip-compresses the providedBlobdata and returns it in a newBlobobject.

parameters.name: blob
parameters.description: ABlobobject to compress usinggzip.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of thegzipfile to be created.

methods.name: gzip(blob, name)
methods.description: gzip-compresses the providedBlobdata and returns it in a newBlobobject. This version of the method allows a filename to be specified.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The bytes for the blob.

methods.name: newBlob(data)
methods.description:
Create a new Blob object from a byte array. Blobs are used in many Apps Script APIs that take
binary data as input.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The bytes for the blob.

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description: The content type of the blob - can benull.

methods.name: newBlob(data, contentType)
methods.description:
Create a new Blob object from a byte array and content type. Blobs are used in many Apps Script
APIs that take binary data as input.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The bytes for the blob.

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description: - The content type of the blob - can benull.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the blob - can benull.

methods.name: newBlob(data, contentType, name)
methods.description:
Create a new Blob object from a byte array, content type, and name. Blobs are used in many Apps
Script APIs that take binary data as input.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The string for the blob, assumed UTF-8.

methods.name: newBlob(data)
methods.description:
Create a new Blob object from a string. Blobs are used in many Apps Script APIs that take
binary data as input.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The string for the blob, assumed UTF-8.

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description: The content type of the blob - can benull.

methods.name: newBlob(data, contentType)
methods.description:
Create a new Blob object from a string and content type. Blobs are used in many Apps Script
APIs that take binary data as input.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The string for the blob, assumed UTF-8.

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description: The content type of the blob - can benull.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the blob - can benull.

methods.name: newBlob(data, contentType, name)
methods.description:
Create a new Blob object from a string, content type, and name. Blobs are used in many Apps
Script APIs that take binary data as input.

parameters.name: csv
parameters.description:
A string containing a single or multiline data in comma-separated value (CSV)
    format.

methods.name: parseCsv(csv)
methods.description: Returns a tabular 2D array representation of a CSV string.

parameters.name: csv
parameters.description:
A string containing a single or multiline data in comma-separated value (CSV)
    format.

parameters.name: delimiter
parameters.description: Between values.

methods.name: parseCsv(csv, delimiter)
methods.description: Returns a tabular 2D array representation of a CSV string using a custom delimiter.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: A string value to parse as a date.

parameters.name: timeZone
parameters.description: The output time zone.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The date format per theSimpleDateFormatspecification.

methods.name: parseDate(date, timeZone, format)
methods.description:
Parses the provided string date according to the specification described in the Java Standard
EditionSimpleDateFormatclass. For more information, see the JavaSimpleDateFormatclass.

parameters.name: milliseconds
parameters.description: The number of milliseconds to sleep.

methods.name: sleep(milliseconds)
methods.description:
Sleeps for specified number of milliseconds. Immediately puts the script to sleep for the
specified number of milliseconds. The maximum allowed value is 300000 (or 5 minutes).

parameters.name: blob
parameters.description: TheBlobof compressed data.

methods.name: ungzip(blob)
methods.description:
Uncompresses aBlobobject and returns aBlobcontaining the uncompressed
data.

parameters.name: blob
parameters.description: The zip file blob.

methods.name: unzip(blob)
methods.description: Takes a Blob representing a zip file and returns its component files.

parameters.name: blobs
parameters.description: A array of blobs to zip up.

methods.name: zip(blobs)
methods.description: Creates a new Blob object that is a zip file containing the data from the Blobs passed in.

parameters.name: blobs
parameters.description: A array of blobs to zip up.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the zip file to be created.

methods.name: zip(blobs, name)
methods.description:
Creates a new Blob object that is a zip file containing the data from the Blobs passed in. This
version of the method allows a filename to be specified.
